meanings.definition: A supporter of King Charles I of England during the English Civil War.
meanings.sent1: During the war, the cavaliers fought bravely for King Charles I.
meanings.sent2: The cavaliers were loyal to King Charles I and his cause.
meanings.sent3: The cavaliers rode into battle with pride and honor.
meanings.sent4: In history books, the cavaliers are remembered for their chivalry and loyalty.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cavaliers charging into battle is etched in our minds.

meanings.definition: A flamboyant or gallant gentleman, especially one acting as a lady's escort.
meanings.sent1: The cavaliers at the ball were dressed elegantly and danced gracefully.
meanings.sent2: He was known as a cavalier for his charming manners and stylish attire.
meanings.sent3: The cavalier escorted the lady with a flourish and a smile.
meanings.sent4: His cavalier attitude and confident demeanor won the hearts of many.
meanings.sent5: The cavalier's presence lit up the room with his charisma and charm.

meanings.definition: A member of a professional basketball team based in Cleveland, Ohio.
meanings.sent1: The cavaliers played a great game last night and won the match.
meanings.sent2: Fans cheered for the cavaliers as they dribbled and shot hoops.
meanings.sent3: The cavaliers practiced hard to improve their skills on the court.
meanings.sent4: In Cleveland, the cavaliers are the pride of the city.
meanings.sent5: Watching the cavaliers play basketball is always exciting and fun.
